result.execSummary:
The defendant William C. Barnes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William C. Barnes

defendant.name: Barnes, William C.
defendant.address: 390 Maranda Drive, Green Cove Springs, FL 32043

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant William C. Barnes appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Comments and recommendation by DA. DA moves to amend to 947.01 Disorderly Conduct Misd. B.  Court questions DE regarding right to attorney. Defendant waives right to attorney. DA certifies victims rights compliance.  Court orders amendment of charge.  Defendant pleads NO CONTEST to amended charge.   Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC.  Court imposes: $300 fine; $200 DNAAS.  Apply bond to fine. Appeal rights given. Adj. 10:33 am.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  DE may not have contact with Antonio Patino, unless there is written consent on file.

10:18 am - Defendant appears in person.  District Attorney, Mark T. Fuhr appears, in person.  Comments by DA regarding request for bond modification.  Court orders $500 cash bond allowing him to leave State of WI.  Court informs DE of keeping Clerk's office apprised of address and phone number and appearing at future court dates.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.    DE may not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior approval of the Court.    DE may not have contact with Antonio Patino, unless there is written consent on file.

2:29 pm - Defendant appears, in person, in custody.  District Attorney, Mark T. Fuhr appears, in person.  Possible charges stated.  Defendant's next court date is 04-14-15 at 10:00 am.  Court gives defendant notice of right to attorney and victim/witness intimidation form.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation.  Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint.  Court sets bond.
